snippet: The broad power that N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell has in ruling on player discipline could come into question if the players in the Saints bounty program test their suspensions in court.
abstract: Broad power that NFL commissioner Roger Goodell has in ruling on player discipline could come into question if the players in the New Orleans Saints bounty program test their suspensions in court. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: The four players suspended by the N.F.L. for their roles in the New Orleans Saints bounty program prepared Thursday for what could be a lengthy attempt to overturn their suspensions. But as the players union's executive director, DeMaurice Smith, and its president, Domonique Foxworth, met with the entire Saints team in New Orleans, it became clear that the effort could go much further, raising questions about the broad power Commissioner Roger Goodell has to decide discipline and then hear appeals.
